ygData.subject: Re: weapon choices at 17th level (was: taking the ghoulbane plunge)
ygData.msgSnippet: Yes I have to agree although if you want to keep up one hand slash I would suggest trying to get a PGT and a Darkwood shield which is a excellent combo
ygData.messageBody:
Yes I have to agree although if you want to keep up one hand slash I would
suggest trying to get a PGT and a Darkwood shield which is a excellent combo
especially if you have high dex. Currently my dwarf has 117 dex and when one
handed he uses the PGT/DW Shield combo. I can tell you this is a great combo
as when those spells are constantly goign off it can save your life numerous
times.

Kananek

>> From: Gary Long <glong@...>
>>
>> This has been an interesting and informative thread, I'm glad I started
>it!
>> Consensus seems to be that:
>> A) Wait until you get past level 25 before even trying to get the sword,
>> B) Ghoulbane is extremely hard to get even at lvl 30 and above,
>> C) There are more appropriate weapons that I should be using until I hit
>> over level 25.
>>
>> Seems like for us honest 17th thru 25th level Paladins our weapon choices
>> are pretty clear:
>> 1. combine longsword or scimitar / shiny brass shield
>> 2. shiny brass halberd
>> 3. hammer of wrath / shiny brass shield
>> ...with the nod going to the shiny brass halberd at level 20.
>>
>> I *like* the way bash interrupts spells, and would regret not being able
>to
>> use it for 5 or more levels. If I switch to a shiny brass halberd then I
>am
>> walking away from 1-handed slashing skill which will need to be made up
>> after I do get ghoulbane.
>>
>> Are there any other weapon/shield combos I am overlooking that actually
>> worked for some of you more accomplished Paladins?
>>
>> Again, thanks everybody for the input.
>> Kaladin, 17th level Paladin (who is not well known for hiding in safe
>> corners of Norrath)
>>

>uses these techniques I don't feel they deserve one. First of all there is
a

You

>camping this thing, it can go bad very quick..people say you can stay in
one
>room safely and keep a couple spawns controlled, but if you really want to
>live keep the whole area clean. Trust me it goes much better this way. Some
>people get lucky and get the sword right away..that has never been my

>many times. It's a long camp but it will be well worth it if you earn it.
